title: It actually baffles me
body:
That Cho'Gath nerfs are still no where to be seen. 

Hello?

replies.body: Out of curiosity, why do you feel like he is in need of any nerfs?

1K+ True Damage on a tank doing perfectly fine TANK role wise is not FINE.


Imagine if this was Yasuo, People would lose their shit and flip.
cho gath can do 1k true damage and nasus is an unkitable super tank that does700 damage every second with q..riot doesn't balance tanks well get over it

Susan is a Juggernaut. His only CC is a slow and death.
Tank cho has 2 hard CC and almost no damage outside [near-]instant death to a squishy of his choice (in range).
Silence is not hard cc
It's not "immobilizing" CC, but it still locks out part of your champion's functionality and therefore qualifies as "hard CC" in my book.

> Crowd controls are grouped into one of two categories depending on whether or not the effect removes total control of the player's character. **Hard CC completely removes all control of a character**, while soft CC only partially removes it.

That's the league wiki definition of it.

By that definition, only Stuns (and displacements by inclusion) qualify.
Pardon me if I have a hard time labeling Morgana's snare as soft CC. (>_>)
Your abilities arent controlling ur character.  Its movement that counts as control.

Is the game using the abilities for me?
I'm pretty sure I controlled when and where to use my character's abilities.
It also includes suppressions, charms, taunts, fears.

It does!
Pardon the brain fart.
If a silence is hard cc since it locks out part of your champs functionality, then Nasus' wither is also hard cc since it locks out adc's from a part of their functionality as well.

Wither doesn't lock anything though. You can still move with reduced MS, and you can still AA with reduced AS.
With silence, you *can not* use abilities (Trynd ult and Cleansing effects exempted).

As I interpret it: Soft CC *inhibits* functionality, Hard CC *removes* functionality.
Yeah you can move 2 units lmao
Silence isn't hard CC

In order to reach high levels of ult damage, cho needs to have absurd HP value in the first place. The fact that he one-shots a squishy at that point as a tank is irrelevant because that's way into the late game and only when they get caught in his CC. Cho can't approach and leisurely take a bite out of them with no resistance from the other team.
He achieves the high level of HP with stoneplate. Doubles his health (which counts as bonus health) which more than doubles his ult scaling. He doesn't need to be super late game either for that.
Stone-plate was psuedo-nerfed. 50% of the steroid is added as base health.

Dodge the knock up and Cho is literally unable to do anything.

He could buy RG, but so could Nasus, anyway.

He has a limit its 6. I think its good that he can have that many stacks, it means hes more likely to have no ult.

I think its too good that ADCs have as many advantages as they have over the 100+ other champions that are too "good" 2 be meta. But oh lets nerf cho because the only late game champions MUST HAVE A GUN, CROSSBOW/BOW AND ARROW, or other ranged pr0sk1ll basic attack.

He feels impossible to fight. You can't beat him down in lane because of his passive, you can't beat him in late because of his ult.

He's a tank with the _strongest_ nuke in the game (seriously. His ult can out-damage Veigar's ultimate). He has a _lot_ of CC (including the highly-hated Silence), a lot of damage even _before_ considering his ultimate's instakill (and without AP!), he has good wave clear, decent sieging capabilities, negligible mana costs, cool downs that aren't that high, moves at a reasonable speed (for a tank), can opt into a _lot_ of items to run at insane speeds...

He just doesn't feel fair to fight in the slightest. And it's not even a Yasuo kind of unfair, where it just sucks to fight him, and you need to wait for him to outplay himself to blow him up. Because he can't really do anything to outplay himself. He just has the worst qualities in a champion. You can't do much to beat him in early (passive means you can't really poke him terribly well, and his actives mean he essentially autowins trades against you), at 6 he gets to nuke you, and in late-game only a Vayne can beat him, because of his insane health totals, tankiness, CC and ability to just obliterate anyone he chooses to. His _only_ weakness is his massive hitbox. And that's a huge problem.

Dunno if Veig is the best example here, he is kind of the mage with the highest burst potential in the entire game.


However stating that Cho can outburst Syndra is not wrong, at least against tanks and others who get some resistances. 

And what you described......it kinda goes for all tanks? They all somewhat quick these days, extremely hard to kill and it's hard to play aggro into all of the currently played ones.


Cho is just the tank that is weaker earlier on but gets stronger later.

I'm sorry, Nectar. I'm sure you mean well and all. But Cho'Gath in his current state is simply unhealthy. A tanky, CC monster that also has range, sustain, and tons of burst on top of sticking power with his E, not to mention his percent health scalings reward him for building tanky by offering even more damage. 

One could say I'm listing only his strengths and none of his weaknesses, but what weaknesses does he have? Everything but his Q is almost assured to land, and even then, his Q isn't that difficult to land against anyone immobile. His one weakness is lack of mobility, which he can make up for with {{item:3742}} {{item:3800}}. But a ton of champions have lack mobility and have other weaknesses besides that. And if you really want to stretch, maybe you could say he has no DPS. Well, besides skirmishers and ADCs, very VERY few champions have any real DPS. His weaknesses are few and far between, and FAR from unique or punishing. 

You're probably not the right person to send this to, but he does need some kind of nerfs in the nearby future.

He shouldn't be simultaneously one of the best tanks in the game and one of the best assassins in the game, the roles are contradictory and should be mutually exclusive, similarly to how Alistar was the best tank in the game and the best healer in the game before you gutted his heal and moved it from his E to his passive.

Infinitely scaling stats are a mistake anyway, they are balanced with the average game time in mind, and a game is rarely average, but often shorter or longer, and now you have a champion that is massively under tuned early on and massively over tuned later on and it feels terrible to play and play against. Having different power curves is fine, Infinite stats cross the line.

The simple fact that an outdated and braindead champion like Cho'Gath is pick/ban in every single competitive game shows how grossly over tuned he is, for a simple champion with very obvious weaknesses not to be exploitable at the highest level of play, he has to pack some of the most overpowered strengths to make up for it, and he does, he is simultaneously the biggest health sponge in the game while also packing tons of crowd control and he has the single best execute in the game.

Well, does riot feel ok for a champion that builds full tank to deal almost 1k true damage after a burst of cc and silence (2 cc), when a squishy champ has like 2k late game? 
 

I'm very curious to hear your design team opinion why cho is balanced

> [{quoted}](name=GripaAviara,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=04eJWKFF,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2017-10-20T23:34:37.798+0000)

Darius can do it multiple times.
Darius doesn't have a knockup he can cast from a mile away.

> [{quoted}](name=SuperLuigiLXIV,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=04eJWKFF,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-20T23:49:08.523+0000)
>
> Darius doesn't have a knockup he can cast from a mile away.

But he can do this to multiple targets. 

Nuking one squishy champ in the late game isn't an issue. Zed has been able to do that for years. So has Rengar. Just stay away from him.
While I don't like Assassins style gameplay, that is not a fair equation, as Cho is a tank designed to take damage, and zed rengar are not.

I love this whole "tanks are designed to take damage" thing. Have you ever seen a fucking behemoth in a movie like Godzilla, able to withstand cruise missile level of damage, knocking everyone into the air- but can't even kill a fly because their "damage" is too low. 

Do you even know what a tank is? A big ass fucking machine capable of taking a lot of hits and yet also capable of destroying a house in a single shot of high explosive. 

They're called TANKS not fucking highly resistant dummy-targets.
Yeah we should make tanks able to consistently 1v1million or else they're extremely weak and need buffs!

Darius is a Juggernaut.

Cho'gath is a Tank.

Very distinct difference
Is Jarvan IV a Tank or a Fighter?

Hes a Fighter.

More specifically, a Diver.

Correct.

In game, though, he's tagged as a Tank, just like Cho'Gath.

With that in mind, do you still think Cho'Gath is a Tank, be it a Vanguard or a Warden? Or do you think ingame tags are outdated and unreliable?
I'm pretty sure the ingame tags are outdated. They released an official list of subclasses a while ago, and updated it again with the removal of "controllers" and introducing "catchers."

Right you are. And this is why people's obsession with calling Cho'Gath a Tank baffles me.

We know the ingame tags are outdated, and Riot has a different class system. I suppose not everyone knows about it, but I would think most people who post on these boards know about it.

He's not a Tank. Riot calls him Unique, but personally, I'd just call him a Juggernaut.

I think why people consider him a tank is because each of his spell except ultimate has heavy CC.
Q is a 1 second AoE knockup followed by 60% slow for 1.5 seconds.
W is a 1.6~2.0 second AoE silence.
E is a 30~50% AoE slow for 1.5 seconds for each of the 3 next AAs.

A lot of juggernauts have CC, but often not as much as Cho'Gath. His CC is on the high side compared to juggernauts, although on the average/low side for tanks.

Darius has a small AoE pull followed by 40% slow (1 second), and a single target 90% slow (1 second).
Garen has a 1.5-3.5 seconds silence. (that one is actually pretty high)
Nasus has one slow that starts at 35% and grows to 47~95% over 5 seconds
Udyr has a 1 second stun.
etc.

I always thought of Cho'Gath as a high single target burst tank, but once I put down the CC duration, he's actually more like a hybrid between a juggernaut and a tank, except unlike most juggernauts, most of his damage is limited to a single target. After that burst, his role is mostly locking down enemies. I guess I see why Riot would categorize him as unique, although I'd agree that he's a tank/juggernaut hybrid.

> [{quoted}](name=The Yetii Rider,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=04eJWKFF,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2017-10-20T23:40:14.669+0000)
>
> Probably because it's melee range and every other juggernaut can kill a 2k health squishy if they get into melee range. 
> 
> Darius can do it multiple times.

Most champs can't generally do that with a single click of a button while also ignoring any form of resistance. The rest of his kit is irrelevant when he can simply flash and basically destroy a squishy with that one click. It's not about how badly he wastes flash or anything like that. It just shouldn't be able to happen. I don't know why people want to defend this. It's true damage for crying out loud. It should not be able to scale that high.

"With a single click of a button"

Cho'gath can't do it with a single click of a button either. He has to get to the enemy. This is why we defend it, this is why we think your crying is ridiculous. You think that it should not be the burden of the squishy character to kite away. We think it should, because it is the burden of the melee character to avoid being kited. 

"Ignoring any form of resistance"

No one cares about Cho chomping on tanks. They care about him deleting squishies. Mages, assassins, supports and marksmen do not build resistances. The main thing that people are actually annoyed about is that the damage is not reduced by Phantom Dancer's passive, but again if you cannot kite you deserve to die. 

"It's true damage for crying out loud. It should not be able to scale that high."

It's an ultimate, on an immobile champion. Immobile champions need something to compensate for them being immobile. For Cho'Gath, that compensation is high single target damage once per 60 seconds or so. That's fair. It's barely different from Veigar, except Cho'Gath is tankier and Veigar has more range.
